snippet: As Israel faces threats both from traditional Shiite adversaries like Iran and from extremist Sunni cells in Syria, Iraq and beyond, officials insist they have no inclination to intervene.
abstract: Israeli officials insist they have no inclination to intervene as chaos in the Middle East escalates, with the mounting strength of extremist Sunni cells in Syria, Iraq and beyond; Israel has embraced a castle mentality, hoping that defenses it has erected will be enough to at least buy the country time in the face of threats both from traditional Shiite adversaries like Iran and newer Sunni threats.
lead_paragraph: As Israel faces threats both from traditional Shiite adversaries like Iran and from extremist Sunni cells in Syria, Iraq and beyond, officials insist they have no inclination to intervene.

headline.main: Region Boiling, Israel Takes Up Castle Strategy
headline.print_headline: Region Boiling, Israel Takes Up Castle Strategy

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
